com.wiris.quizzes.api

Class Quizzes

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wiris.quizzes.api.Quizzes

  • public class Quizzes
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class that builds all Wiris Quizzes API objects.
    Since:
    4.0.0.

      • getInstance

        public static Quizzes getInstance()
        Get a Quizzes object. This is the entry point to the Wiris Quizzes API.
        Returns:
        An instance of Quizzes.

      • getQuizzesComponentBuilder

        public QuizzesComponentBuilder getQuizzesComponentBuilder()
        Get a QuizzesComponentBuilder object. This class is responsible for the creation of UI components in the Wiris Quizzes API.
        Returns:
        An instance of QuizzesComponentBuilder.

      • newQuestion

        public Question newQuestion()
        Creates a new empty Question object.

      • newQuestionInstance

        public QuestionInstance newQuestionInstance(Question q)
        Creates a new QuestionInstance object from the given Question.
        Parameters:
        q - The question related to the new QuestionInstance. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if q is null.

      • readQuestion

        public Question readQuestion(java.lang.String xml)
        Creates a new Question object reading its contents from XML. It is the inverse operation that the Serializable.serialize() method of Question object.
        Parameters:
        xml - The XML definition of the Question object. The root tag is <question>.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if the parameter is malformed XML or if the root tag is not <question>

      • readQuestionInstance

        public QuestionInstance readQuestionInstance(java.lang.String xml,
                                    Question q)
        Creates a new QuestionInstance object reading its contents from XML. It is the inverse operation that the Serializable.serialize() method of QuestionInstance object.
        Parameters:
        xml - The XML definition of the QuestionInstance object. The root tag is <questionInstance>.
        q - The question related to the new QuestionInstance. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if the parameter is malformed XML, if the root tag is not <questionInstance> or if q is null.

      • newVariablesRequest

        public QuestionRequest newVariablesRequest(java.lang.String html,
                                  QuestionInstance instance)
        Creates a new QuestionRequest object suitable to send to the quizzes service in order to get variable values generated from an algorithm.
        Parameters:
        html - The text/html with placeholders for variables. It is used to get the names of the variables to be requested. The placeholders are variable names prefixed with the symbol #, and they may be inside MathML formulas. If null the variable names will be taken from the second parameter. It is specially useful when one want to rebuild the variables from a given QuestionInstance because the cache is not ready.
        instance - The question instance with the random seed. If null it will be a new one will be initialized with an unknown random seed.
        Returns:
        The request ready to be sent to the service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if instance is null.

      • newGradeRequest

        public QuestionRequest newGradeRequest(QuestionInstance instance)
        Creates a new QuestionRequest object suitable to send to the quizzes service in order to evaluate a set of student answers against a set of correct answers using a defined criteria.
        Parameters:
        instance - The question instance, with the random seed. If it is null a new random seed will be set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - If instance is null, or if the Question object associated to the instance parameter is parsed (lazily) from XML within this method and it is malformed XML or if correctAnswers or studentAnswers MathML contain malformed semantics annotation.
        See Also:
        newSimpleGradeRequest(String, String)., newMultipleAnswersGradeRequest(String[], String[]).

      • newSimpleGradeRequest

        public QuestionRequest newSimpleGradeRequest(java.lang.String correctAnswer,
                                    java.lang.String studentAnswer)
        Creates a new QuestionRequest object suitable to send to the quizzes service in order to evaluate a student answer against a correct answer using the default criteria. This method is a shortcut for simple integrations that only need to compare student's answers and teacher's answers using the default criteria. The method newGradeRequest(QuestionInstance) is to be used to grade questions that have customizable grading criteria, as the ones created using the Wiris Quizzes Studio.
        Parameters:
        correctAnswer - The correct answer.
        studentAnswer - The student's answer.
        Returns:
        The question request, ready to be sent to the server.
        See Also:
        newMultipleAnswersGradeRequest(String[], String[])., newGradeRequest(QuestionInstance).

      • newMultipleAnswersGradeRequest

        public QuestionRequest newMultipleAnswersGradeRequest(java.lang.String[] correctAnswers,
                                             java.lang.String[] studentAnswers)
        Like newSimpleGradeRequest(String, String) but this method allows to compare several student's answers with several correct answers using the default comparison criteria. This method is a shortcut for simple integrations that only need to compare student's answers and teacher's answers using the default criteria. The method newGradeRequest(QuestionInstance) is to be used to grade questions that have customizable grading criteria, as the ones created using the Wiris Quizzes Studio. The pairing between correct answers and user answers is done grouping answers in equal sized sets. For example, if 4 correct answers {a, b, c, d} and 2 user answers {x, y} are provided, it will be compared {a=x, b=x, c=y, d=y}.
        Parameters:
        correctAnswers - Array of correct or teacher answers.
        studentAnswers - Array of student answers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - If Question parameter is parsed (lazily) from XML within this method and it is malformed XML or if correctAnswers or studentAnswers MathML contain malformed semantics annotation.
        See Also:
        newSimpleGradeRequest(String, String)., newGradeRequest(QuestionInstance).

      • newFeedbackRequest

        public QuestionRequest newFeedbackRequest(java.lang.String html,
                                 QuestionInstance instance)
        Create a QuestionRequest that evaluates the student answer(s) and gets the variables to be used in the feedback. The returned Request is the request compound of the two calls:
        • newGradeRequest(instance)
        • newVariablesRequest(html, instance)
        This call sets the student answer(s) as algorithm parameter(s) and therefore it can be used to produce computed feedback from student answers.
        Parameters:
        html - The text where to find the variable placeholders to be used.
        instance - The question instance with student answers. It must be built using the methods of this class rather than the deprecated ones at QuizzesBuilder to make sure it is properly associated to a Question object.
        Returns:
        The request ready to be sent to the service.
        See Also:
        newVariablesRequest(String, QuestionInstance), newGradeRequest(QuestionInstance), PropertyName.STUDENT_ANSWER_PARAMETER_NAME

      • getQuizzesService

      • getResourceUrl

        public java.lang.String getResourceUrl(java.lang.String name)
        Get the url of a static resource, to be linked from client-side.
        Parameters:
        name - The filename of the resource eg: wirisquizzes.css.

      • newFeaturedSyntaxAssertionsRequest

        public QuestionRequest newFeaturedSyntaxAssertionsRequest(Question question)
        Create a QuestionRequest that deduces the possible syntax assertions for the correct answers of the question. If a correct answer has not any syntax assertion, the returned response contains an error.
        Parameters:
        question - The question definition.
        Returns:
        The request ready to be sent to the service.

      • newFeaturedAssertionsRequest

        public QuestionRequest newFeaturedAssertionsRequest(Question question)
        Create a QuestionRequest that deduces the possible assertions for the correct answers of the question. The service computes the possible assertions from the correct answers and the syntactic assertions.
        Parameters:
        question - The question definition.
        Returns:
        The request ready to be sent to the service.
